TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BaseInputConnection extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Android.Views.InputMethods.IInputConnection, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Base class for implementors of the InputConnection interface, taking care of most of the common behavior for providing a connection to an Editable.

remarks.para: Base class for implementors of the InputConnection interface, taking care of most of the common behavior for providing a connection to an Editable. Implementors of this class will want to be sure to implement to provide access to their own editable object, and to refer to the documentation in .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool CommitText (Java.Lang.ICharSequence text, int newCursorPosition);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool CommitText(class Java.Lang.ICharSequence text, int32 newCursorPosition) cil managed

Docs.param: The text to commit. This may include styles.

The new cursor position around the text, in Java characters. If > 0, this is relative to the end of the text - 1; if <= 0, this is relative to the start of the text. So a value of 1 will always advance the cursor to the position after the full text being inserted. Note that this means you can't position the cursor within the text, because the editor can make modifications to the text you are providing so it is not possible to correctly specify locations there.
Docs.summary: Default implementation replaces any existing composing text with the given text.

remarks.para: Default implementation replaces any existing composing text with the given text. In addition, only if dummy mode, a key event is sent for the new text and the current editable buffer cleared.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool SetComposingRegion (int start, int end);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool SetComposingRegion(int32 start, int32 end) cil managed

Docs.param: the position in the text at which the composing region begins
the position in the text at which the composing region ends
Docs.summary: Mark a certain region of text as composing text.

remarks.para: Mark a certain region of text as composing text. If there was a composing region, the characters are left as they were and the composing span removed, as if has been called. The default style for composing text is used.

The passed indices are clipped to the contents bounds. If the resulting region is zero-sized, no region is marked and the effect is the same as that of calling . The order of start and end is not important. In effect, the region from start to end and the region from end to start is the same. Editor authors, be ready to accept a start that is greater than end.
Since this does not change the contents of the text, editors should not call and IMEs should not receive .

This has no impact on the cursor/selection position. It may result in the cursor being anywhere inside or outside the composing region, including cases where the selection and the composing region overlap partially or entirely.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void SetComposingSpans (Android.Text.ISpannable text);
.method public static hidebysig void SetComposingSpans(class Android.Text.ISpannable text) cil managed
public virtual bool SetComposingText (Java.Lang.ICharSequence text, int newCursorPosition);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool SetComposingText(class Java.Lang.ICharSequence text, int32 newCursorPosition) cil managed

Docs.param: The composing text with styles if necessary. If no style object attached to the text, the default style for composing text is used. See for how to attach style object to the text. and are two implementations of the interface .

The new cursor position around the text. If > 0, this is relative to the end of the text - 1; if <= 0, this is relative to the start of the text. So a value of 1 will always advance you to the position after the full text being inserted. Note that this means you can't position the cursor within the text, because the editor can make modifications to the text you are providing so it is not possible to correctly specify locations there.
Docs.summary: The default implementation places the given text into the editable, replacing any existing composing text.

remarks.para: The default implementation places the given text into the editable, replacing any existing composing text. The new text is marked as in a composing state with the composing style.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool SetComposingText (string text, int newCursorPosition);
.method public hidebysig instance bool SetComposingText(string text, int32 newCursorPosition) cil managed

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
